note.p: Death: His house in Red Lion Square, Westminster (09 April 1709)

Career: Sheriff of Yorkshire (1676-1677, 1677-1678); MP for Aldborough (1679-1681); MP for Thirsk (1695-death); Commissioner of Public Accounts; Controller of Army Accounts (1691); close friend of Sir Hans Sloane (FRS 1685); died of a quinsy; left money to the Royal Society which was used to found the Copley Medal (first awarded 1736)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; GEC Baronetage; Henning; LI
References: W H G Armytage, 'Sir Godfrey Copley, FRS (1653-1709). Some Tercentenary Glimpses through Letters to his Friends' in NR 1954-55 vol 11 pp 54-74, plate
R E W Maddison, 'Abraham Hill, FRS (1635-1722)' in NR 1960 vol 15 pp 173-182
Notes: Proposed by Sir John Hoskins. GEC says he was said to have been 13 at the Heralds' Visitation of Yorkshire in 1666
